intro: Miliusa velutina var. deviyarina, commonly known as the hairy miliusa, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruits are typically round and turn from green to yellow as they mature. The variety deviyarina is distinguished by its slightly hairy texture on the leaves, giving it its common name.
